postBodyContent: luke skywalker? i thought he was a myth.

i don‚Äôt think anyone understands that when i say i get secondhand embarrassment easily i mean at the first sign of trouble for a character in a television show i immediately pause and sit there for ten to thirty minutes thinking ‚Äúoh god they fucked up‚Äù

MOODBOARD ‚Äì  Lily Evans

All that could be seen of Lily Evans was a blur, her bright red hair flying behind her, the movement making it seem like flames. (x)

ALSO I‚Äôm now just f a s c i n a t e d by the interplay of narrator-burr, looking back on his actions with some regret, and in-the-action burr, convinced what he‚Äôs doing is right and necessary‚Ä¶ sometimes it gives the impression that he‚Äôs getting caught up in the action, becoming invested in events despite part of him being outside and above them. sometimes he‚Äôs desperately defending himself, as in The World Was Wide Enough as the duel is getting set up, where he‚Äôs /shouting/ - and I mean he sounds /unhinged/ - his Totally Valid Reasons for why shooting Hamilton made sense at the time. and then right after he shoots he slides back into the larger historical perspective!!

in conclusion leslie odom jr is fucking brilliant and I‚Äôm so pleased
and if when everything ends, nothing is left in my hands‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs alright.

things that do romanticize mental illness

  • neurotypical people picking and choosing which parts of a mental illness to portray in media and deliberately glossing over the unpleasant parts and struggles neurodivergent people face

things that do not romanticize mental illness

  • neurodivergent people feeling cute and loving themselves
  • neurodivergent people posting about how they headcanon their favorite characters as being like them
The name‚Äôs Finn and I‚Äôm in charge. I‚Äôm in charge now, Phasma. I‚Äôm in charge.
